017package org.microbean.qualifier;
018
019import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
020import java.lang.constant.Constable;
021import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
022import java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc;
023import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
024import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
025import java.lang.constant.MethodTypeDesc;
026
027import java.util.Arrays;
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.Map.Entry;
031import java.util.Optional;
032import java.util.TreeMap;
033
034import java.util.function.Function;
035import java.util.function.Predicate;
036
037import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
038import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_Object;
039import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.DEFAULT_NAME;
040import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.NULL;
041import static java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc.Kind.STATIC;
042
043import static org.microbean.qualifier.ConstantDescs.CD_Qualifiers;
044
045/**
046 * A {@link Constable}, immutable, sorted set of key-value pairs that
047 * can be used to further qualify an object for many different
048 * purposes.
049 *
050 * <p>Keys are sorted according to their natural order.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>This is a <a
053 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
054 * class</a>.</p>
055 *
056 * <p>Values of type {@code K} must be members of classes adhering to
057 * <a
058 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
059 * semantics</a>.</p>
060 *
061 * <p>Values of type {@code V} must be members of classes adhering to
062 * <a
063 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
064 * semantics</a>.</p>
065 *
066 * <p>Undefined behavior will result if the preceding requirements are
067 * not honored.</p>
068 *
069 * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in this
070 * {@link Qualifiers}
071 *
072 * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in this
073 * {@link Qualifiers}
074 *
075 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
076 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
077 *
078 * @see #of(Comparable, Object)
079 */
080public final class Qualifiers<K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> extends Bindings<K, V> {
081
082
083  /*
084   * Static fields.
085   */
086
087
088  private static final Qualifiers<?, ?> EMPTY_QUALIFIERS = new Qualifiers<>();
089
090
091  /*
092   * Constructors.
093   */
094
095
096  /**
097   * Creates a new {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty} {@link
098   * Qualifiers}.
099   */
100  public Qualifiers() {
101    super(Map.of(), Map.of(), false);
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Creates a new {@link Qualifiers}.
106   *
107   * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} representing the qualifiers; may be
108   * {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
109   * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
110   */
111  public Qualifiers(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers) {
112    super(qualifiers, Map.of(), true);
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Creates a new {@link Qualifiers}.
117   *
118   * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} representing the qualifiers; may be
119   * {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
120   * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
121   *
122   * @param info informational key-value pairs; may be {@code
123   * null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
124   * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
125   */
126  public Qualifiers(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers,
127                    final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> info) {
128    super(qualifiers, info, true);
129  }
130
131  private Qualifiers(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers,
132                     final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> info,
133                     final boolean copy) {
134    super(qualifiers, info, copy);
135  }
136
137
138  /*
139   * Instance methods.
140   */
141
142
143  /**
144   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
145   * representing this {@link Qualifiers}, or an {@linkplain
146   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} if any of this {@link
147   * Qualifiers}' keys or values is neither a {@link Constable} nor a
148   * {@link ConstantDesc}.
149   *
150   * <p><strong>Note:</strong> Only entries that are binding are
151   * described.</p>
152   *
153   * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
154   * representing this {@link Qualifiers}; never {@code null}
155   *
156   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
157   *
158   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
159   *
160   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
161   * threads.
162   */
163  @Override // Constable
164  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
165    final Collection<Entry<K, V>> entrySet = this.toMap().entrySet();
166    if (entrySet.isEmpty()) {
167      // Rehydrate via Qualifiers.of()
168      return
169        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
170                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
171                                                CD_Qualifiers,
172                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
173                                                                          CD_Qualifiers,
174                                                                          "of",
175                                                                          MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Qualifiers))));
176    }
177    final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = 2 * entrySet.size() + 1;
178    final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
179    // Rehydrate via Qualifiers.of(Object...)
180    bsmInvokeArguments[0] =
181      MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
182                                CD_Qualifiers,
183                                "of",
184                                MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Qualifiers,
185                                                  CD_Object.arrayType()));
186    int i = 1;
187    for (final Entry<K, V> entry : entrySet) {
188      final ConstantDesc k;
189      final Object key = entry.getKey();
190      if (key instanceof Constable ck) {
191        k = ck.describeConstable().orElse(null);
192      } else if (key instanceof ConstantDesc cd) {
193        k = cd;
194      } else {
195        return Optional.empty();
196      }
197      bsmInvokeArguments[i++] = k;
198      final ConstantDesc v;
199      final Object value = entry.getValue();
200      if (value == null){
201        v = NULL;
202      } else if (value instanceof Constable cv) {
203        v = cv.describeConstable().orElse(null);
204      } else if (value instanceof ConstantDesc cd) {
205        v = cd;
206      } else {
207        return Optional.empty();
208      }
209      bsmInvokeArguments[i++] = v;
210    }
211    return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
212                                                   DEFAULT_NAME,
213                                                   CD_Qualifiers,
214                                                   bsmInvokeArguments));
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Returns a <strong>usually new</strong> {@link Qualifiers} whose
219   * keys are produced by the supplied {@link Function}, which is
220   * expected to prepend a prefix to the original key and return the
221   * result.
222   *
223   * <p>If this {@link Qualifiers} is {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty},
224   * then {@code this} is returned.</p>
225   *
226   * @param f a deterministic, idempotent {@link Function} that
227   * accepts keys drawn from this {@link Qualifiers}' {@linkplain
228   * Map#entrySet() entry set} and returns a non-{@code null} prefixed
229   * version of that key; may be {@code null} in which case {@code
230   * this} will be returned
231   *
232   * @return a <strong>usually new</strong> {@link Qualifiers} whose
233   * keys have been prefixed by the actions of the supplied {@link
234   * Function}
235   *
236   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code f} is {@code null}
237   *
238   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
239   *
240   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic,
241   * assuming the supplied {@link Function} is.
242   *
243   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
244   * threads, assuming the supplied {@link Function} is
245   */
246  public final Qualifiers<K, V> withPrefix(final Function<? super K, ? extends K> f) {
247    if (f == null || this.isEmpty()) {
248      return this;
249    } else {
250      final Map<K, V> bindings = new TreeMap<>();
251      for (final Entry<? extends K, ? extends V> entry : this.toMap().entrySet()) {
252        bindings.put(f.apply(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
253      }
254      final Map<K, V> info;
255      final Map<K, V> myInfo = this.info();
256      if (myInfo.isEmpty()) {
257        info = Map.of();
258      } else {
259        info = new TreeMap<>();
260        for (final Entry<? extends K, ? extends V> entry : myInfo.entrySet()) {
261          info.put(f.apply(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
262        }
263      }
264      return new Qualifiers<K, V>(bindings, info, false);
265    }
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} with additional
270   * entries sourced from the supplied {@link Qualifiers}.
271   *
272   * <p>The returned {@link Qualifiers} <strong>will be new</strong>
273   * unless {@code qualifiers} is {@code null} or {@linkplain
274   * #isEmpty() empty}, in which case {@code this} will be
275   * returned.</p>
276   *
277   * @param qualifiers a {@link Qualifiers} whose entries will be part
278   * of the new {@link Qualifiers}, displacing any that already exist;
279   * may be {@code null} or {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty} in which
280   * case {@code this} will be returned; all keys and values must be
281   * immutable (not just unmodifiable) or undefined behavior will
282   * result
283   *
284   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} with additional entries sourced from
285   * the supplied {@link Qualifiers}; never {@code null}
286   *
287   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
288   *
289   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
290   *
291   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
292   * threads.
293   *
294   * @see #plus(Map)
295   */
296  public final Qualifiers<K, V> plus(final Qualifiers<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers) {
297    if (qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty()) {
298      return this;
299    } else {
300      return this.plus(qualifiers.toMap(), qualifiers.info());
301    }
302  }
303
304  /**
305   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} with additional
306   * entries sourced from the supplied {@link Map}.
307   *
308   * <p>The returned {@link Qualifiers} <strong>will be new</strong>
309   * unless {@code qualifiers} is {@code null} or {@linkplain
310   * Map#isEmpty() empty}, in which case {@code this} will be
311   * returned.</p>
312   *
313   * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} whose entries will be part of the
314   * new {@link Qualifiers}, displacing any that already exist; may be
315   * {@code null} or {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty} in which case
316   * {@code this} will be returned; all keys and values must be
317   * immutable (not just unmodifiable) or undefined behavior will
318   * result
319   *
320   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} with additional entries sourced from
321   * the supplied {@link Map}; never {@code null}
322   *
323   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
324   *
325   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
326   *
327   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
328   * threads.
329   */
330  public final Qualifiers<K, V> plus(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers) {
331    return this.plus(qualifiers, Map.of());
332  }
333
334  /**
335   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} with additional
336   * entries sourced from the supplied {@link Map}s.
337   *
338   * <p>The returned {@link Qualifiers} <strong>will be new</strong>
339   * unless both {@link Map}s are {@code null} or {@linkplain
340   * Map#isEmpty() empty}, in which case {@code this} will be
341   * returned.</p>
342   *
343   * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} whose entries will be part of the
344   * new {@link Qualifiers}, displacing any that already exist; may be
345   * {@code null} or {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty} in which case an
346   * {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty <code>Map</code>} will be used
347   * instead; all keys and values must be immutable (not just
348   * unmodifiable) or undefined behavior will result
349   *
350   * @param info informational key-value pairs; may be {@code
351   * null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
352   * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
353   *
354   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} with additional entries sourced from
355   * the supplied {@link Map}s; never {@code null}
356   *
357   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
358   *
359   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
360   *
361   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
362   * threads.
363   */
364  public final Qualifiers<K, V> plus(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> qualifiers,
365                                     final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> info) {
366    if (qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty()) {
367      if (info == null || info.isEmpty()) {
368        return this;
369      } else {
370        final Map<K, V> newInfo = new TreeMap<>(this.info());
371        newInfo.putAll(info);
372        return new Qualifiers<>(this.toMap(), newInfo, false);
373      }      
374    } else if (info == null || info.isEmpty()) {
375      final Map<K, V> newQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(this.toMap());
376      newQualifiers.putAll(qualifiers);
377      return new Qualifiers<>(newQualifiers, this.info(), false);
378    } else {
379      final Map<K, V> newQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(this.toMap());
380      newQualifiers.putAll(qualifiers);
381      final Map<K, V> newInfo = new TreeMap<>(this.info());
382      newInfo.putAll(info);
383      return new Qualifiers<>(newQualifiers, newInfo, false);
384    }
385  }
386
387
388  /*
389   * Static methods.
390   */
391
392
393  /**
394   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} that is logically empty.
395   *
396   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
397   * returned {@link Qualifiers} (somewhat moot since the returned
398   * {@link Qualifiers} will be empty)
399   *
400   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
401   * returned {@link Qualifiers} (somewhat moot since the returned
402   * {@link Qualifiers} will be empty)
403   *
404   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} that is logically empty
405   *
406   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
407   *
408   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
409   *
410   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
411   * threads.
412   */
413  // Used by #describeConstable()
414  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
415  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of() {
416    return (Qualifiers<K, V>)EMPTY_QUALIFIERS;
417  }
418
419  /**
420   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
421   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}.
422   *
423   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
424   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
425   *
426   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
427   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
428   *
429   * @param bindings the {@link Map} of qualifier names and values;
430   * may be {@code null} in which case the return value of the {@link
431   * #of()} method will be returned
432   *
433   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
434   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}
435   *
436   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
437   *
438   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
439   *
440   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
441   * threads.
442   *
443   * @see #of(Map, Map)
444   */
445  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> bindings) {
446    return of(bindings, Map.of());
447  }
448
449  /**
450   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
451   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}s.
452   *
453   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
454   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
455   *
456   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
457   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
458   *
459   * @param bindings the {@link Map} of qualifier names and values;
460   * may be {@code null} in which case the return value of the {@link
461   * #of()} method will be returned
462   *
463   * @param info informational key-value pairs; may be {@code null} in
464   * which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty <code>Map</code>}
465   * will be used instead
466   *
467   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
468   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}
469   *
470   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
471   *
472   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
473   *
474   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
475   * threads.
476   *
477   * @see #of(Comparable, Object)
478   */
479  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> bindings,
480                                                                               final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> info) {
481    if (bindings == null || bindings.isEmpty()) {
482      if (info == null || info.isEmpty()) {
483        return of();
484      } else {
485        return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(), info, true);
486      }
487    } else if (info == null || info.isEmpty()) {
488      return new Qualifiers<>(bindings, Map.of(), true);
489    } else {
490      return new Qualifiers<>(bindings, info, true);
491    }
492  }
493
494  /**
495   * Returns a new {@link Qualifiers} with a single qualifier whose
496   * name is the supplied {@code name0} argument, and whose value is
497   * the supplied {@code value0} argument.
498   *
499   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
500   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
501   *
502   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
503   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
504   *
505   * @param name0 the qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
506   *
507   * @param value0 the new value; must not be {@code null}
508   *
509   * @return a new {@link Qualifiers} with a single qualifier whose
510   * name is the supplied {@code name0} argument, and whose value is
511   * the supplied {@code value0} argument
512   *
513   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code name0} or {@code
514   * value0} is {@code null}
515   *
516   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
517   *
518   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
519   *
520   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
521   * threads.
522   */
523  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0) {
524    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0), Map.of(), false);
525  }
526
527  /**
528   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
529   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
530   *
531   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
532   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
533   *
534   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
535   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
536   *
537   * @param name0 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
538   *
539   * @param value0 the qualifier value corresponding to the
540   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
541   *
542   * @param name1 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
543   *
544   * @param value1 the qualifier value corresponding to the
545   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
546   *
547   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
548   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
549   *
550   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
551   *
552   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
553   *
554   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
555   * threads.
556   */
557  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0,
558                                                                               final K name1, final V value1) {
559    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0, name1, value1), Map.of(), false);
560  }
561
562  /**
563   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
564   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
565   *
566   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
567   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
568   *
569   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
570   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
571   *
572   * @param name0 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
573   *
574   * @param value0 the qualifier value corresponding to the
575   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
576   *
577   * @param name1 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
578   *
579   * @param value1 the qualifier value corresponding to the
580   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
581   *
582   * @param name2 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
583   *
584   * @param value2 the qualifier value corresponding to the
585   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
586   *
587   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
588   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
589   *
590   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
591   *
592   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
593   *
594   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
595   * threads.
596   */
597  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0,
598                                                                               final K name1, final V value1,
599                                                                               final K name2, final V value2) {
600    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0, name1, value1, name2, value2), Map.of(), false);
601  }
602
603  /**
604   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
605   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
606   *
607   * <p>The supplied {@code nameValuePairs} must be an even-numbered
608   * array of non-{@code null} {@link Object} instances, where the
609   * zero-based even-numbered elements represent qualifier keys, and
610   * the zero-based odd-numbered elements represent qualifier
611   * values.</p>
612   *
613   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
614   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
615   *
616   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
617   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
618   *
619   * @param nameValuePairs the name-value pairs as described above;
620   * may be {@code null} in which case the return value of the {@link
621   * #of()} method will be returned
622   *
623   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
624   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
625   *
626   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if an even number of
627   * arguments is not supplied
628   *
629   * @exception ClassCastException if elements in the supplied array
630   * at even positions ({@code 0}, {@code 2}, {@code 4}…) are not of
631   * type {@code K}
632   *
633   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
634   *
635   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
636   *
637   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
638   *
639   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
640   * threads.
641   */
642  // Used by #describeConstable()
643  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
644  public static final <K extends Comparable<? super K>, V> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final Object... nameValuePairs) {
645    if (nameValuePairs == null || nameValuePairs.length <= 0) {
646      return of();
647    } else if (nameValuePairs.length % 2 != 0) {
648      throw new IllegalArgumentException("nameValuePairs: " + Arrays.toString(nameValuePairs));
649    } else {
650      final Map<K, V> map = new TreeMap<>();
651      for (int i = 0; i < nameValuePairs.length; i++) {
652        map.put((K)nameValuePairs[i++], (V)nameValuePairs[i]);
653      }
654      return new Qualifiers<>(map, Map.of(), false);
655    }
656  }
657
658}
